title: Electrolysis of NaCl - voltage for reaction

content.question: What is the approximate minimum voltage that must be supplied to a <math alttext="1.0 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> solution of <math alttext="N a C l aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> to produce <math alttext="N a O H aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> according to the reaction above? (<math alttext="F is approximately equal to 100,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>â‰ˆ</mo><mn>100</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> coulombs per mole of electrons.)

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
